articles.title: Plea In Supreme Court Challenges BNSS Provisions Allowing Judicial Officers To Head Directorate Of Prosecution
articles.summary: A practising lawyer has filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court challenging the constitutional validity of Sections 20(2)(a) and 20(2)(b) of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023 which allow judicial officers to be appointed as Director of Prosecution, Deputy Director of Prosecution or Assistant Director of Prosecution. The plea contends that the impugned provisions blur the constitutionally mandated separation between the judiciary and the executive, and erode prosecutorial autonomy.

articles.title: 分析：清洁能源2025年为中国GDP增长贡献超过三分之一
articles.summary: 2025年，太阳能、电动汽车及其他清洁能源技术对中国经济增长的贡献已超过三分之一，并拉动超过九成的投资增长。 中国清洁能源行业产值在2025年达到创纪录的15.4万亿元人民币（约合2.1万亿美元），约占国内生产总值（GDP）的11.4%，该数字相当于巴西或加拿大的经济规模。 Carbon Brief基于官方数字、行业数据及分析师报告进行的最新分析显示，2022年至2025年间，中国清洁能源行业的实际规模几乎翻了一番；若将其视为一个独立经济体，其规模可位列全球第八。 该分析的其他主要成果包括： 这些投向清洁能源制造业的资金，代表着对中国乃至全球能源转型的重大押注，也为政府和企业保持这一发展势头提供了动力。 然而，未来的长期走势仍然存在不确定性，尤其是在太阳能领域。受136号文件下的新定价机制影响，太阳能发电装机增速已有所放缓，而中央政府设定的相关目标也明显低于近几年的实际扩张水平。 如果放缓趋势持续下去，这些产业或将从经济增长的驱动力转变为拖累因素，同时加剧工业领域的“产能过剩”问题，并进一步恶化国际贸易摩擦。 但即便中央政府对清洁能源未来五年的目标设定较为谨慎，地方政府和国有企业的规划

articles.summary: India is exploring oil purchase options from Venezuela and other countries. The government prioritizes energy security for its citizens. Diversifying energy sources is key to this strategy. India s actions will align with market conditions and global dynamics. This comes as trade discussions with the US include potential shifts in oil sourcing.

articles.title: 'Humiliating': Allahabad High Court Sets Aside Single Judge's Order Asking Student To Display 'Won't Misbehave With Girls' Placard
articles.summary: The Allahabad High Court on Wednesday set aside a direction passed by a Single Judge asking a rusticated university student to stand at the university gate for 30 minutes (for 30 days) carrying a placard with the message that he would "never misbehave with any girl". Terming the direction as unjustified and humiliating, a bench of Chief Justice Arun Bhansali and Justice Kshitij Shailendra added that such a punishment would leave a "permanent scar" on the student's character. articles.title: Delhi Court Denies Bail To Olympian Wrestler Sushil Kumar In Sagar Dhankar Murder Case
articles.summary: A Delhi Court on Friday denied bail to Olympic wrestler Sushil Kumar in relation to the case of murder of 27-year-old former junior national wrestling champion Sagar Dhankar in May 2021. articles.title: Denial of depreciation to trust not justified as genuineness of building construction expense proved
articles.summary: ITAT Bangalore held that once the genuineness of the building construction expenditure is proved, the consequential claim of depreciation on such genuine assets cannot be denied to trust since depreciation was claimed only on actual assets used for charitable purpose. The post Denial of depreciation to trust not justified as genuineness of building construction expense proved appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: High Share Premium Alone Can’t Trigger Section 68 Addition: Calcutta HC
articles.summary: Addition under Section 68 cannot be sustained merely due to high share premium when investors are identifiable, traceable, and supported by audited financial records. The post High Share Premium Alone Can’t Trigger Section 68 Addition: Calcutta HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.summary: Total expenses during the quarter rose sharply to Rs 1,113 crore, up from Rs 796 crore in Q2FY26 and Rs 851 crore in Q3FY25, reflecting a 40% sequential increase and a 31% year-on-year rise. The higher costs were driven by employee benefits, raw material expenses, and finance costs, among other factors.

articles.title: YouTube’s auto-dubbing feature goes global with expanded language library: What it means
articles.summary: YouTube has rolled out its auto-dubbing feature to everyone. Check the complete language list, new features, and more.

articles.title: How global companies are quietly turning India into their second home
articles.summary: Global capability centres are reshaping India’s office market, jobs and capital flows, turning the country into a long-term hub for high-value global work and growth.

articles.title: Mumbai court clears DHFL, now Piramal Finance, in ₹5,050 crore money laundering case
articles.summary: A Mumbai special PMLA court discharged DHFL, now Piramal Finance, in a ₹5,050 crore money laundering case, granting immunity under Section 32A of the IBC after its takeover through insolvency.

articles.title: EU accuses TikTok of 'addictive design,' seeks changes to protect users
articles.summary: The European Union has accused TikTok of breaching digital rules over “addictive design” features such as autoplay and infinite scroll. EU regulators said the app failed to properly assess risks to mental and physical health, including children. The European Commission said TikTok should change the basic design of its service, which the company denied.

articles.title: Security concerns, scepticism bursting bubble of Moltbook, viral AI social forum
articles.summary: Moltbook is a new "social network" built exclusively for AI agents to make posts and interact with each other, and humans are invited to observe. Elon Musk said its launch ushered in the "very early stages of the singularity " - or when artificial intelligence could surpass human intelligence.

articles.title: Iran backs Chabahar port, ready to expand ties with India
articles.summary: Iran reaffirms its commitment to the Chabahar port and cooperation with India, despite US sanctions uncertainty. While a recent budget showed no allocation, India has fulfilled its $120 million commitment and maintains a $250 million credit line for future development. Iran's ambassador highlighted the port's strategic importance for regional access and expressed confidence in India's management of the situation.

articles.title: Iran open to working with India on Chabahar port, says Iranian envoy
articles.summary: Iran said it remains open to India’s involvement at Chabahar port, even as New Delhi cut budgetary allocation to zero amid US sanctions concerns

articles.title: PB Fintech shelves plan to raise funds for acquisitions via QIP
articles.summary: In a regulatory filing to stock exchanges on Friday, the company said its management and board are not considering a qualified institutional placement (QIP), refuting a media report.

articles.title: What the budget changes for mental health
articles.summary: This article is authored by Nandini Chatterjee Singh, head of the department, professor of psychology, Ashoka University.

articles.title: Myntra consolidates Gurugram satellite ops with Bengaluru HQ leading to some transfers & layoffs: Sources
articles.summary: Myntra is consolidating its Gurgaon operations into its Bengaluru headquarters, relocating some roles and implementing layoffs with severance packages, according to sources. This strategic move aims to centralize teams and enhance synergy across the company. The changes affect approximately 50 roles within the Catalogue Operations team and are not linked to AI impact or performance-related issues.

articles.title: The sale of xAI comes with tax, financial and legal benefits for xAI and SpaceX investors
articles.summary: Instead of combining the two companies into ⁠one and fully integrating operations, Musk decided to retain xAI, which runs social media platform X and created the Grok chatbot, as a wholly owned subsidiary of SpaceX, said the people, who asked not to be named because the details of the deal have not been publicly released.

articles.title: AI data centres could spur Internet era-type job boom, says Nvidia’s Jensen Huang
articles.summary: The CEO of the AI major said AI infrastructure would create jobs across construction, supply chains, operations, and innovation, alongside direct employment. His comments follow the Union Budget 2026, which has extended tax holidays for data centre investments, a move expected to attract up to $200 billion into India

articles.title: Norway to probe foreign ministry over alleged Jeffrey Epstein links
articles.summary: Norway's economic crime police unit said on Thursday it was investigating Jagland on suspicion of aggravated corruption.

articles.title: You may donate online via danamojo.
SpaceX delays Mars plans to focus on 2027 moon landing: Report
articles.summary: The company will ‌target March 2027 for a lunar landing without astronauts on board, the report added. The news comes after SpaceX agreed to acquire xAI ​in a deal that values ​the rocket and satellite company at $1 ‌trillion and ‍the artificial intelligence outfit at $250 billion.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics mobilises Rs 1,248 crore from anchor investors; IPO to open on February 9
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics on Friday garnered Rs 1,248.26 crore from anchor investors, days before the opening of its initial public offering (IPO). The anchor book saw broad-based participation from a mix of leading domestic and global institutional investors, reflecting robust demand for the issue.

articles.title: MediaTek bets on automotive, Nvidia-partnered superchips
articles.summary: Fabless semiconductor major MediaTek is doubling down on 'new engines' of growth, specifically targeting the automotive sector and high-performance computing to expand its footprint beyond its traditional stronghold in the smartphone market.

articles.title: India’s largest pre-silicon chip validation facility opens at C-DAC Bengaluru
articles.summary: The Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) has launched the PRITVI-ACE pre-silicon validation facility in Bengaluru to strengthen India’s semiconductor design ecosystem. According to C-DAC officials, it enables end-to-end validation, from individual IP blocks to full system-level designs, well before silicon fabrication. These include early operating system boot, firmware and driver validation, protocol compliance checks and performance benchmarking at near-real-world speeds.

articles.title: PhysicsWallah raises stake in Kamya Yoga & Wellness to 41% with Rs 1.5 crore investment
articles.summary: Noida-based edtech firm PhysicsWallah (PW) will raise its stake in Kay Lifestyle and Wellness to 41.18% by subscribing to 300 seed CCPS for Rs 1.5 crore. PW currently holds 28.57% and could increase its share up to 50% under the agreement. The investment is expected to complete by February 2027.

articles.title: Tech shares, bitcoin stabilise after a week of severe declines
articles.summary: Indian markets are set for a positive start. Technology stocks are showing signs of recovery after a tough week. Bitcoin's sharp fall appears to have paused, offering some relief. Investors are watching these developments closely. Global markets are also experiencing mixed movements. This could influence trading trends in the coming sessions.

articles.title: Global chip sales expected to hit $1 trillion this year, industry group says
articles.summary: The group, which represents most US chip firms, said that chip sales hit $791.7 billion in 2025, an increase of 25.6% ‌over the ‌previous year. That booming growth is expected to continue into this ‌year as major technology firms around the world spend hundreds of billions of dollars to build out data centers for artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Tesla is training its AI technology in China: Report
articles.summary: ​Tesla ⁠is operating an artificial ‌intelligence ‌training ‌centre in China focusing on local ​application ​and assisted ‌driving, ‍Chinese ‍media outlet Cailianshe reported ‌on Friday, citing the company's ‍Vice President ‍Tao ⁠Lin.

articles.title: Big Tech stocks hit Wall Street, Alphabet loses despite strong financials
articles.summary: The S P 500 fell 0.9% and is heading toward its sixth loss in the seven days since it set an all-time high. The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 449 points, or 0.9%, as of 2:06 p.m. Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 1% lower.

articles.title: Intel, AMD notify customers in China of lengthy waits for CPUs
articles.summary: The supply constraints have driven up prices for Intel's ⁠server products in China by more than 10% generally, although pricing varies by customer contract, according to one of the people.

articles.title: Social media's role must be assessed from lens of societal harmony, trust: Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Noting that social media is now among the most important modes of information and outreach, the minister said while it offers benefits such as learning, its broader impact must be clearly assessed to ensure they add value to society, their content is trustworthy and the platforms do their due diligence.

articles.title: Reddit forecasts revenue above estimates as AI fuels ad sales
articles.summary: The company announced its first share repurchase ‌program of up ‌to $1 billion, citing strong profitability and cash generation that give it the flexibility ‌to return capital to shareholders while continuing product investments.

articles.title: Amazon projects 50% boost to capital spending this year to $200 billion, shares tumble
articles.summary: It is the latest sign that Big Tech will not be hitting the brakes any time soon on hefty AI investments. Amazon shares closed down 4.4% during regular trading as worries deepened about the enormous cost of the artificial-intelligence boom.

articles.title: Alphabet and discouraging data on the US job market drag Wall Street lower
articles.summary: A sharp drop for Google's parent company is dragging the U.S. stock market lower on Thursday, while prices for bitcoin, silver and gold weaken. Yields are also sinking in the bond market following discouraging news on the US job market.

articles.title: US layoffs jump 205% in January, hitting 17-year high driven by UPS, Amazon
articles.summary: Planned layoffs soared 205% to 108,435 last month, global outplacement firm Challenger, Gray Christmas said. That was the highest reading for any January since 2009 when the Great Recession was drawing ‌to a ‌close. Announced layoffs were 118% higher compared with January 2025.

articles.title: US software stocks stabilise after bruising selloff on AI disruption fears
articles.summary: Software and data services stocks stabilized on Thursday after a bruising selloff, as investors looked ‍for clues on whether fast-advancing artificial ​intelligence tools are starting to dent demand for traditional software and subscription businesses.

articles.title: Spotify to let users buy physical books on app through Bookshop partnership
articles.summary: Spotify said on Thursday it will begin selling physical books ‍on its streaming platform through ​a partnership with online retailer Bookshop.org, marking an unexpected ⁠expansion beyond its audiobooks business. The company is doubling down on new features to better compete with rival streaming services from tech giants such as ‌Apple and Amazon.

articles.title: TSMC to make advanced AI semiconductors in Japan in boost for its chipmaking ambitions
articles.summary: The advanced chips set to be made in Kumamoto will be used in AI, robotics and autonomous driving, sectors that Takaishi's cabinet has designated as strategically important fields. TSMC's first Kumamoto plant started mass production in late 2024 and makes less advanced chips.

articles.title: Here is why Anthropic claims to keep Claude ad-free forever
articles.summary: In a blog on Wednesday, the startup wrote that AI conversations are bound to be more personal and trust-based than search or social media. The company argued that advertising creates a conflict of interest. An assistant influenced by ads might subtly steer users toward products or purchases, making it hard to know whether advice is genuinely helpful or commercially motivated.

articles.title: Imports from China fall across sectors in FY25; mobile phone exports surge
articles.summary: India's imports from China saw a significant decline in 2024-25 across key sectors like fertilisers, chemicals, and iron and steel. Notably, mobile phone imports plummeted while exports surged dramatically, indicating a shift in trade dynamics. The government is actively implementing measures to address stakeholder concerns and safeguard national interests.

articles.title: PM MITRA parks get infra boost
articles.summary: Expenditure of ₹564.72 crore has been incurred so far on the seven PM Mega Integrated Textile Region and Apparel (PM MITRA) parks, the textile ministry told Parliament.

articles.title: Pulses prices jump up to 20%; tur, urad return to MSP levels
articles.summary: Pulse prices are climbing after a year of falling. Tur, chana, and urad have seen significant increases. Tur and urad have reached minimum support price levels. Lower crop output in India and other countries, along with currency issues, are pushing prices up. Farmers may see improved sentiment ahead of the next planting season. New chana arrivals could impact prices later.

articles.title: German machinery exports to India to rise 10-15 pc in 2026: Industry body
articles.summary: German machinery exports to India are set for a significant boost. Industry experts predict a 10-15% growth in 2026, especially after the India-EU free trade agreement is implemented. This agreement will unlock new opportunities for commerce. German technology is crucial for India's manufacturing goals. Germany is already India's largest EU trading partner.

articles.title: How India plans to safeguard ‘Chicken’s Neck’ through an underground rail network
RBI’s inflation gaze adds gold and silver prices along with onion and tomatoes
articles.summary: RBI MPC: The Reserve Bank of India is watching gold and silver prices closely. These rising costs are now a key part of their inflation forecast. Core inflation remains steady, showing underlying price pressures are still low. Food inflation is expected to be stable. Geopolitical risks and weather could impact prices. The RBI expects headline inflation to stay near its target.

articles.title: Dish TV India sinks deeper into losses in Q3 as subscription revenues continue to slide
articles.summary: Dish TV reported a net loss of approximately Rs 276 crore for Q3 FY26, sharply higher than the loss of around Rs 47 crore reported in the same quarter last year. The company reported exceptional items of around Rs 70 crore during the quarter, taking the loss before tax to about Rs 276 crore.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics raises Rs 1,249 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO; Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs among key backers
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics raised Rs 1,249 crore from 52 anchor investors at Rs 900 per share ahead of its IPO opening February 9. Strong domestic and global institutional demand signals confidence in the AI analytics firm and growth prospects globally strong.

articles.title: Amazon shares slide as $200 billion outlay fans fears over AI returns
articles.summary: Amazon.com shares slid 9% on Friday after the company ‍outlined a planned $200 billion capital outlay ​for the year, stoking investor concerns about the scale of Big Tech's spending on artificial ⁠intelligence.

articles.title: Dow jumps 800 pts, S&P, Nasdaq rebound over 1% after week-long tech slump
articles.summary: Wall Street indexes rebounded Friday, with the S P 500 and Nasdaq advancing after a week of tech selloffs. Optimism was tempered by Amazon's significant drop following increased AI infrastructure spending forecasts. Investor skepticism around AI capital expenditures intensified, impacting Big Tech and software shares.

articles.title: These 9 stocks trading below their industry average PE
articles.summary: Based on a valuation scan by StockEdge.com, we have identified the top nine stocks from the Nifty200 segment with PE ratios below their respective industry averages.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: LIC, Godfrey Phillips among 6 stocks that hogged limelight on Friday
articles.summary: Indian markets closed higher as buying in consumer and private banks offset losses in auto, IT and pharma. Stock-specific moves in BEML, LIC, Hitachi Energy and others drove action across the board.

articles.title: Anand Rathi reports Rs 13 crore fraud by unknown individuals, group company employees
articles.summary: Anand Rathi Share and Stock Brokers on Friday informed the exchanges that its Internal Inquiry Committee has discovered a Rs 13 crore fraud. The brokerage said that the crime has been committed by certain unknown individuals in connivance with employees of group company Anand Rathi IT Private Limited.

articles.title: ITC, Godfrey Phillips, other cigarette stocks jump up to 13% amid reports of price hike
articles.summary: Cigarette company shares saw a significant jump on Friday. This surge followed reports of price increases, with firms like ITC, Godfrey Phillips, and VST Industries passing on higher costs to consumers. The market also saw value buying after a recent tax overhaul. Higher priced cigarette packets have been introduced, with price hikes ranging from 15% to 30%.

articles.title: Japan's Nikkei rallies on earnings in unsteady trade before Sunday election
articles.summary: The impact of earnings, recent sharp share declines, and the weekend's impending election contributed ‍to a ⁠sense of tug-of-war in ⁠Tokyo's equity markets, said Maki Sawada, an equities strategist at Nomura Securities.

articles.title: Indians show no urge to press buy button for AI PCs
articles.summary: Global demand for AI PCs is slowing faster than expected, and India is seeing a similar trend as buyers hesitate over higher prices. Gartner has cut its 2026 forecast, citing weak consumer interest and lack of compelling software. Hardware limits, especially memory shortages, are further holding back adoption.

articles.title: The dark side of AI weighs on the stock market
articles.summary: A washout hit software stocks as Wall Street realised the threat from artificial intelligence had arrived. New tools from a San Francisco startup triggered a sudden reckoning, pushing investors to sell. The sell-off dragged the broader market lower, briefly turning the S P 500 negative for the year this past week.

articles.title: ETtech Deals Digest: Startups raise $198 million this week, up 28% on-year
articles.summary: The number of deals during the week was also down at 27 transactions, compared to 51 in the corresponding week last year.

articles.title: Security concerns and scepticism are bursting the bubble of Moltbook, the viral AI social forum
articles.summary: A new social media platform called Moltbook has emerged, exclusively for AI agents. Humans can observe but not directly participate. This development has generated significant buzz, with some hailing it as a step towards the singularity. However, security researchers have uncovered critical vulnerabilities, raising alarms about data exposure and potential manipulation.

articles.title: IIT Madras & Unicorn India Ventures launch Rs 600-crore deeptech fund
articles.summary: IIT Madras and Unicorn India Ventures have launched a Rs 600-crore deeptech fund, with a Rs 400-crore greenshoe option, to support early-stage, IP-driven startups. The fund will back engineering-heavy firms in robotics, space, defence, semiconductors, and medical technology, investing Rs 8–10 crore in over 25 startups.

articles.title: Big Tech's AI spending war; PB Fintech shelves QIP plan
articles.summary: Big Tech stocks tumble amid AI spending pledges despite strong quarterly earnings. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Amazon shares sink as Big Tech's AI spending plans worry investors
articles.summary: Amazon's capex spending plans are expected to reach $200 billion in 2026. Alphabet said its capex could double from a year ​ago, while Meta and Microsoft has ramped ​up their spending plans. "While the rising capital intensity is not ‌a ‍surprise directionally, the magnitude of the spend is materially ‍greater than consensus expected," MoffettNathanson analysts said in a note.

articles.title: AI is not a bubble, senior executive at Nvidia supplier Wistron says
articles.summary: Wistron's order situation is ​good up into 2027, and for this ‌year growth ‍will be "significant" compared with the ‍prior year, chairman Simon Lin said.

articles.title: Elon Musk says space will be the cheapest place for AI data centres in three years
articles.summary: Talking on the Dwarkesh Podcast, co-hosted by Dwarkesh Patel and Stripe cofounder John Collison, Musk said Earth has some insurmountable power bottlenecks in scaling AI. "The availability of energy is the issue," Musk said, noting global electricity output outside China remains "pretty close flat" while chip production surges.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics IPO: CEO and early investors set to make up to 2,24,000% returns
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics’ upcoming ₹2,834-crore IPO is set to generate significant wealth for promoters and early investors, allowing them to monetise long-term investments as India’s first pure-play AI company goes public at a top price of ₹900 per share. The issue, opening February 9–11, includes a ₹1,023-crore fresh issue and a ₹1,810-crore offer for sale.

articles.title: AI tools fabricate Epstein images 'in seconds,' study says
articles.summary: AI tools can easily fabricate convincing images of Jeffrey Epstein with world leaders, a study showed Thursday, following a surge of manipulated photos falsely linking prominent politicians to the convicted sex offender. Social media users have amplified AI-generated images purporting to show the convicted sex offender socializing with politicians such as New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani and his mother, award-winning filmmaker Mira Nair, AFP's fact-checkers have previously reported.

articles.title: Big Tech plans to spend about $650 billion on AI computing in 2026
articles.summary: The spending planned by Alphabet Inc., Amazon.com Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., all in pursuit of dominance in the still-nascent market for AI tools, is a boom without a parallel this century. Each of the companies’ estimated outlay for this year would set a high-water mark for capital spending by any single corporation in any one of the past 10 years, according to Bloomberg data.

articles.title: Anthropic, OpenAI rivalry spills into new Super Bowl ads as both fight to win over AI users
articles.summary: The fiercest competition between the two AI developers, along with bigger companies like Google, is a race to win over corporate leaders looking to adopt AI tools to boost workplace productivity. The rivalry is also spilling into other realms, including the Super Bowl.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: Auto wrap this week: Mercedes reveals 2026 F1 car; Honda, Suzuki, Yamaha launch models
articles.summary: India’s auto sector saw several launches this week, from Mercedes-AMG Petronas revealing its 2026 F1 car to Honda, Suzuki and Yamaha updating 125cc scooters and introducing electric mobility options.

articles.title: Trump's racist post about Obamas deleted after backlash despite White House earlier defending it
articles.summary: Donald Trump deleted a Truth Social post with racist images of the Obamas as primates, drawing bipartisan outrage and condemnation from key leaders.

articles.title: Nimbus Realty sees home sales jump 43% as its Greater Noida project is finally completed
articles.summary: Nimbus Realty posted strong Q3FY26 momentum, with pre-sales up 43%, collections nearly tripling, and full completion of a key Greater Noida housing project boosting execution credibility.

articles.title: Women’s hygiene brand Pee Safe to deploy $32 million to expand retail reach, scale quick commerce and brand building
articles.summary: With profitability intact and operations spanning India and overseas markets, Pee Safe is betting on deeper distribution, faster last-mile delivery and new women’s health categories as it aligns its growth strategy with rising policy focus on menstrual hygiene.

articles.title: India slips to fourth in MSCI EM Index weight as South Korea pulls ahead
articles.summary: India’s weight in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index has slipped to fourth as investors chase AI- and semiconductor-led rallies elsewhere, with foreign outflows and limited tech exposure weighing on domestic equities.

articles.title: LIC focuses on margin quality over aggressive growth
articles.summary: The insurer’s focus remains on improving the quality of growth rather than expanding market share at any cost.

articles.title: Global markets may bleed, but India will win: Quant MF’s Sandeep Tandon explains why
articles.summary: Quant Mutual Fund Founder & CIO Sandeep Tandon says global market stress could redirect capital flows towards India, even as he flags selling exhaustion, a sharp portfolio shift towards private banks and insurance, and valuation risks in overheated sectors such as defence and global technology.

articles.title: India’s valuation premium narrows as AI-led rally lifts global peers
articles.summary: Nifty50’s valuation premium to peers has narrowed as Taiwan, Japan, and South Korea outperform. India lags due to weak earnings, FPI selling, and limited AI semiconductor exposure.

articles.title: Islamabad suicide attack kills at least 31, injures 169 at Shia Mosque in Pakistan
articles.summary: The blast took place in the Tarlai area on the outskirts of the city when an attacker detonated explosives near the entrance of the mosque. It is not clear yet who is behind the attack as no militant group has claimed responsibility.

articles.title: Commodities cool off, but investors aren't calling the end of the rally yet: Elara Capital
articles.summary: Elara Capital says the commodity pullback looks like consolidation, not reversal, as fund flows stay supportive of de-dollarisation, emerging markets, and energy despite short-term volatility.

articles.title: KIMS sees healthy Q3 sales, but higher costs drag profits
articles.summary: Krishna Institute of Medical Sciences Limited saw Q3 net profit drop 39.8% despite 29.2% revenue growth, with margin pressure. Expansion plans in Bengaluru, Nashik and Mumbai continue.

articles.title: SBI set for steady Q3 show as loan growth holds firm, profit growth stays muted
articles.summary: All eyes will be on SBI’s management commentary around loan growth momentum, asset quality trends and margin outlook, as investors assess the bank’s ability to sustain performance amid higher provisions and an unchanged interest rate environment.

articles.title: Icra sees 10-12% copper demand growth in India over next 2 years
articles.summary: Copper usage in India is surging, driven by rapid urbanisation, infrastructure development, and the green energy transition.

articles.title: Godawari Power Q3 sales takes a hit, but margins come to the rescue
articles.summary: Godawari Power posted a mixed Q3, with revenue falling and profit largely flat, but stronger operating performance lifted margins despite a softer topline environment.

articles.title: Global uncertainty drives market volatility; India relatively stable: Emmer Capital CEO
articles.summary: Manishi Raychaudhuri, Chief Executive Officer, Emmer Capital Partners said India has remained relatively stable compared with other Asian markets. He sees opportunities in financials, materials, industrials, and selective consumer stocks, while remaining cautious on IT services due to AI disruption risks.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: India-US trade deal lifts market mood, industry sees relief for key export sectors
articles.summary: Industry leaders Rajiv Memani, Amit Kalyani, Sanjay Budhia and Suvankar Sen welcome the India-US trade deal, citing tariff relief and improved export prospects.

articles.title: Mitsubishi Electric India to invest ₹2,100 crore in Chennai facility at Mahindra Origins
articles.summary: Mitsubishi Electric India inaugurated a ₹2,100 crore air-conditioner and compressor plant near Chennai, boosting localisation, manufacturing capacity and employment, while reinforcing Tamil Nadu’s position as a key electronics and industrial hub.

articles.title: Tata Chemicals to spend ₹515 crore on Tamil Nadu salt plant
articles.summary: Tata Chemicals will invest ₹515 crore to set up an IVSD salt plant in Tamil Nadu with 210 KTPA capacity, creating a second production base and improving supply to southern markets.

articles.title: Versace names Pieter Mulier as new creative director
articles.summary: Mulier joins Versace from French fashion house Alaïa, where he has served as creative director since 2021. He was previously the longtime collaborator of fellow Belgian designer and Prada co-creative director Raf Simons, working with him at Calvin Klein, Jil Sander and Christian Dior.

articles.title: Exclusive: UPL, Coromandel among 4 firms in race for US-giant FMC's India biz
articles.summary: UPL, Dhanuka, Coromandel, and Crystal Crop may bid for FMC’s India unit, worth $450M, as FMC seeks to cut debt and refocus globally.

articles.title: Toyota Motor Corp profit drops 43%, CFO Kenta Kon to become CEO
articles.summary: Toyota Motor Corp reported a 43% drop in quarterly profit and named CFO Kenta Kon as its next CEO, citing US tariff pressure and rising costs, while maintaining its full-year earnings forecast.

articles.title: Rio Tinto, Glencore shelve ambitions to form world's largest miner, abandons $200 billion deal
articles.summary: Rio Tinto ended takeover talks with Glencore, halting plans for a $200 billion mining giant. Failed negotiations follow previous attempts, as sector consolidation continues amid rising metal demand.

articles.title: TrumpRx: Donald Trump launches new website to sell drugs to Americans at lower costs
articles.summary: President Donald Trump launched TrumpRx.gov, a website offering discounted drugs from companies like Novo Nordisk, Pfizer, and Eli Lilly, aiming to address affordability ahead of elections.

articles.title: Bitcoin's monthslong slide continues, hitting fresh 15-month low of $67,000
articles.summary: The original cryptocurrency, pitched as “digital gold,” has lost 46% of its value since Oct. 6, when it hit a record high of $126,210.50, according to crypto trading platform Coinbase.

articles.title: Top stories: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha, stocks slide, RBI MPC tomorrow, HAL chief on fighter jet race & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: Swiss watch brand Atlantic Watches plans to double India stores as demand for mid-priced luxury watches grows
articles.summary: After a strong first year in India, Swiss watchmaker Atlantic Watches is scaling up its retail presence, banking on rising demand for mid-priced luxury timepieces and India’s growing relevance in the global Swiss watch industry.

articles.title: Gemini to exit EU, UK, Australia; cuts 25% of workforce as tech stocks slide
articles.summary: Gemini exits EU, UK, Australia, cutting 25% of staff. Tech stocks tumble, Qualcomm down 11%, Alphabet 7%, Hims & Hers rises, gold miners fall 4%.

articles.title: No country is AI-ready: Pearson CEO flags skill gaps in India, warns of vocational shortage
articles.summary: India and other major economies face deep-rooted workforce challenges as artificial intelligence accelerates, with Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh warning that shortages in vocational skills and educator preparedness could slow inclusive AI adoption.

articles.title: Mad Over Donuts initiates minority stake sale amid flurry of dessert deals
articles.summary: Gourmet doughnut chain Mad Over Donuts explores private equity investment with teasers having been sent to prospective suitors amid deal buzz in India’s QSR and dessert segment.

articles.title: AI is making skills go obsolete faster, so learning how to learn is the real job now: Pearson CEO
articles.summary: As AI tools rapidly take over routine professional tasks, Pearson Global CEO Omar Abbosh says continuous learning—not static qualifications—will determine who stays relevant in the workforce, as companies and employees confront a multi-year disruption driven by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Sula Vineyards' profit slumps for fifth straight quarter as Karnataka destocking hits Q3
articles.summary: Net profit was down 67.5% year-on-year to ₹9.1 crore, compared with ₹28 crore in the same period last year.

articles.title: Big profit drop for Jana SFB in Q3, but deposits and asset quality offer comfort
articles.summary: Net interest income (NII) rose 13.8% YoY to ₹675 crore, up from ₹593 crore in the corresponding quarter last year.

articles.title: BLS International posts strong Q3 as profits soar, bags big visa and Aadhaar deals
articles.summary: Operating performance saw some pressure, with the EBITDA margin slipping to 26.9%, from 30.8% in the year-ago quarter, reflecting a contraction of 390 basis points.

articles.title: Ratnamani Metals feels the heat in Q3 as profit and revenue slide
articles.summary: Revenue from operations declined 19.8% YoY to ₹1,055.8 crore, down from ₹1,316 crore in the same period last year.

articles.title: Amit Shah begins two-day Jammu & Kashmir visit to review security, inaugurate development works
articles.summary: Amit Shah’s packed itinerary in Jammu includes a ground-level security assessment along the International Border, rollout of welfare initiatives for border guards, and high-level meetings focused on counter-terror preparedness and the region’s development roadmap.
